reviewText: This DVD is entertaining and historical. And for that reason I have to disagree with the reviewer who dislikes the interspaced commentary by Otis Williams. The performances at the beginning are very dated with some in black and white. And so Otis' narration of events in today's vivid color setting can only improve the DVD as a whole. Above all the disk provides a DTS option for excellent audio. Considering the historical nature it's a very good production of the Temptations.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, it took long enough for the item to arrive!  However, this is one of the best music DVD's ever!  ALL vidoes are extremely clear!  So clear that you would think that they just filmed them a minute ago - except for the clothes of course!Each video is preceded by Otis Williams explaining how each song came to be and the events surrounding each song.  Normally I would say just give me the videos, but this was actually a good addition.  About 98% of the videos are in color and all are very clear and clean.  For those of us who were not around and view the 1960's as a period that we cannot imagine ever living in, this gives us a better idea for the period.  I still cannot get over how during the worst years of racism in the US, they would be invited to sing on TV and whites could listen to the music, but hate them for being black otherwise.  Not to mention anything else they had to go through during those times.  Funny how a lot of that died down after J Edgar Hoover died...Anyway, I would highly recommend this as it probably cannot get any clearer than this, unless they HD'd it.  Even then there may be a problem.  The sound is right and exact and I like the sound options.  This is one of the few DVD's with actual DVD features that we expected in the late 90's!  This one puts the Supremes DVD to shame and maybe whoever did this needs to do the Supremes!This disc has all of their hits and most of their performances.  There were others that I saw that did not make on here.  If they ever do a Blu Ray verison, I expect ALL peroformances since most are dead.It is too bad other material from the 60's cannot be made to look this good.  If they could, the 60's would not look so much like another dimension in time.  It is also too bad many shows did not tape in color since ot was available.  Imagine what the JFK assasination events video would have looked like today?
summary: The Way Music DVD's Should Be Done!

reviewText: I grew up in the golden age of Soul Music. I remember seeing the Tempts, Supremes and 4 Tops live on TV on the likes of Ed Sullivan and other variety shows of the era. I loved seeing these old clips, some I've never seen, some I'd not seen in twenty years or so. Here we see the Temptations in all their glory. What made them special in our neighborhood was not just their incredible harmonies but their steps!!! All the groups could sing but only the Tempts could sing and dance like that!!!! And it was not all flash either. The subtle moves during their performance of "My Girl" as as beautiful as any harmony.  If you view them as what they were, not song writers, not revolutionaries or purveyors of funk but merely as a performing vocal group, then they have no peer. This DVD was well worth the money, Detroit at it's finest.Da Worfster
summary: A great DVD for perhaps the greatest vocal group of all time!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this DVD as a gift for my husband and I must say that I enjoyed it as much as he did. These are the Temptations as I remember seeing them as I was growing up. Even our grandchildren were enthralled with exactly seeing the real Temptations ("But they don't look like the people in the movie," said our six years old grandaughter). Once we explained to her that these were the real people and not actors playing parts, she just couldn't get over how good they were. They were a very talented group of young men who helped change the music industry. If I could change anything about this DVD it would be to include more selections and cut back on some of the commentary by Mr. Otis Williams. Don't get me wrong, the commentary was great, but it did kind of cut in on the selections.  My husband was especially pleased with the booklet that was included. All in all a great DVD and one well worth having in your collection of the greatest musical talents of the day.

reviewText: To the already long list of repeated lauding that this DVD and it's makers absolutely deserve.  I received this DVD last week, and I am so truly mesmerized by the Temptations at their finest.  I watched the performance of I Wish It Would Rain 3 times this morning before leaving for work!! It's addictive.It is a privilege to see these performances in such good quality, but mostly to see these fine young men called the Temptations.  And when I say fine, I mean that in terms of dignified and classy (unlike the pitiful excuse for R&B; music that is available today).  And I am 28 years old mind you, so I wasn't even thought about when the Tempts were doing their thing, but I feel like I am right there with the studio audiences watching these beautiful performances.Their energy, their love for what they were doing, their ability to make the song scream from their hearts, and of course those untouchable dance moves make the classic line up of the Tempts (thats the line-up I love the most:)) a force to be reckoned with, for all time. I wish so badly I could have had the experience of seeing them live in the sixties.  But this video is the next best thing. What's sad is that these are apparently rare films of the performances.  Back then I guess they didn't realize the treasure they had in the making, the history they had in the making.  That this music would influence generations.  I am so thankful to be able to see this.Thanks for reading :)

reviewText: These guys are fantastic.  They are without a doubt, the best motown group that ever was.  They're fantastic performers as this shows and it's nice to see all the originals here.  The songs are catchy and infectious and this dvd is thoroughly enjoyable.  It's something that every Temptations fan must own because it's got some of their best footage on here.  I love it and hope you all enjoy it as much as I do.  It's also great to have this kind of footage on a dvd for the quality.  I highly recommend this.

Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is just awesome, I almost got teary eyed when I realized we'll never see artists and performers as talented and genuine as these were. I say were because for the most part, they're no longer with us but thank god someone recorded this for generations of fans to enjoy. I was particularly moved with the scene where the Temps are recording with the terrific, but then unknown Funk Bros. Motown's house band who were class A musicians themselves and how simple and honest the whole performance and recording process was, without all the electronic gizmos they have to use nowadays to manufacture pop figures who don't have either the talent or the appreciation for real music these great performers had. I just hope there's more of this in the vaults, there are so many great groups and performers that were part of the Motown family, that fans like me would love to see.
summary: A must have for fans of REAL music

reviewText: I bought this DVD in 2007 and have enjoyed it ever since. If you are a fan of soul music and The Temptations and you would like to go a little bit back to when it all started this is a must have for you. The DVD is also an addition to their live 80s DVD issued earlier. The sounds on the DVD have been mastered well, given the fact that all these songs were recorded some time ago. The choreography, albeit still in its infancy, is still unmatched. Forever Temps.

reviewText: Truly an extraordinary DVD package which includes the very essence of the Temptations!Most of the performances were lip-synched, but just to see them perform on these classic clips, you can truly feel the magic either for the first time if you haven't seen them during their glory days or if you are a nostalgic fan revisiting the past!  Groovy shows such as the Hollywood Palace, The Ed Sullivan Show (of which I have many video clips of the Tempts on VHS) and Murray the K features the Tempts doing what they are known around the world for...doing their precise movements, singing their tight harmonies AND looking good doing it!For me, the extras are what impress me, especially viewing the Tempts hard at work on SORRY IS A SORRY WORD, a taping for the CBS News segment, THE MOTOWN SOUND.Otis's interview throughout the DVD and during the bonus feature is also another highlight for me.  He was there through it all and is still around to tell us about the magic of the Temptations!The acapella section on 15 of their biggest hits continues to awe and astound me!  It is like they didn't need a rhythm section...the harmonies were that tight!Complete with never-before released photos and another excellent essay by Rob Bowman, this is a must have!
summary: Keep up the good work, UMe and Reelin'!
